DOC.brief_summary: Osteopathic medicine base diagnostic therapeutic system treat tissue mobility/ motility dysfunction general , use different approach ( depend target tissue ) know osteopathic manipulative treatment . Among available technique one address cranial field question lack scientific evidence ; compression 4th ventricle technique largely studied clinical trial . Studies show technique may affect central autonomous nervous system , modulate reflex ( Traube-Hering baro signal ) , modify brain cortex electrical activity central sensitization subject chronic low back pain . Thus , investigator hypothesize compression 4th ventricle may modulate peak alpha frequency ( electroencephalographic assessment ) promote physical relaxation subject vigil .
DOC.brief_title: Electroencephalography Activity Individuals With Nonspecific Chronic Low Back Pain After Cranial Osteopathic Manipulative Treatment
DOC.detailed_description: A randomize control crossover trial blind assessor design test hypothesis . A total 81 participant assign three treatment condition , seven day washout : compression 4th ventricle group ; sham compression 4th ventricle group ; control group ( intervention ) . All participant recruit Outpatient Rehabilitation Service University Hospital Brasília - University Brasília ( Brazil ) .
DOC.criteria: Participants 18 year old selfreported nonspecific chronic low back pain recruit Participants suffer secondary chronic low back pain , fever , chill , sweat , weight loss , asthenia , anorexia ; cardiovascular respiratory symptom chest pain , dyspnea cough ; headache , dizziness , lightheadedness , fainting , tremor , dysarthria aphasia ; participant underwent surgery spine ; diagnosis neurological , cardiac , respiratory rheumatic disease ; regular use drug effect central nervous system .
